English: The word of the LORD that came to Hosea the son of Beeri, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel.
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Hôsia, kon drŏ-nglo Bêri, lăm chăl Usia Jôtham Ahas, Hesekia, lu pơtao đe Juđa. Lăm chăl Jêrôbôam, kon drŏ-nglo Jôas pơm pơtao đe Isơrael.

English: When the LORD began to speak by Hosea, the LORD said to Hosea: “Go, take yourself a wife of harlotry And children of harlotry, For the land has committed great harlotry By departing from the LORD.”
Bahnar: Kơplah Kră Yang pơtơm khan kơ Hôsia, Kră Yang khan kơ sư: Năm bĕ, iŏk oei kơ akăn luĕl 'blal păng pơjing kon pơm kư̆ kă yua kơ lăm dêh char âu pơm pơyô kư̆ kă kơnê̆ dêh, đei achăng lê̆ Kră Yang.

English: So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim, and she conceived and bore him a son.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Hôsia iŏk hĭ Gômer, kon adruh Diblaim, drŏ-kăn noh anăp na tơpŭ ăn minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo.

English: Then the LORD said to him: “Call his name Jezreel, For in a little while I will avenge the bloodshed of Jezreel on the house of Jehu, And bring an end to the kingdom of the house of Israel.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang khan kơ sư: “Athei krao anăn sư Jêsreel, yua kơ ưh pă đunh dơ̆ng boih, Inh gô phak adrĕch Jêhu yua kơ pham lu bơngai sư pơlôch tơ Jêsreel păng Inh gô pơtôch lê̆ dêh char Isơrael.

English: It shall come to pass in that day That I will break the bow of Israel in the Valley of Jezreel.”
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh Inh gô gơ̆ lê̆ hră lu bơngai Isơrael tơ lăm Thŭng Jêsreel.”

English: And she conceived again and bore a daughter. Then God said to him: “Call her name Lo-Ruhamah, For I will no longer have mercy on the house of Israel, But I will utterly take them away.
Bahnar: Akăn sư anăp dơ̆ng na tơpŭ ăn kơ sư minh 'nu kon drŏ-kăn, na Kră Yang khan kơ Hôsia: “Ih krao anăn sư Lôruhama, yua kơ Inh ưh pă đei 'mêm mơnat dơ̆ng boih kơ adrĕch Isơrael, wă kơ Inh kư̆m ưh pă mơnat pơklaih tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu sư dơ̆ng.

English: Yet I will have mercy on the house of Judah, Will save them by the LORD their God, And will not save them by bow, Nor by sword or battle, By horses or horsemen.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh gô 'mêm mơnat kơ adrĕch Juđa; Inh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư gô dŏng pơklaih lu sư, Inh ưh kơ pơklaih lu sư hăm hră dah hăm đao gưm ôh; dah tơdrong tơblah, hăm aseh, dah hăm bơngai hao aseh ôh.

English: Now when she had weaned Lo-Ruhamah, she conceived and bore a son.
Bahnar: Truh tơ Lôruhama pă mŏm boih, mĕ sư anăp tơpŭ dơ̆ng minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo.

English: Then God said: “Call his name Lo-Ammi, For you are not My people, And I will not be your God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Hôsia: “Anăn bĕ sư Lôami, yua kơ lu iĕm ưh pă jing kon pơlei Inh dơ̆ng boih, noh wă khan Inh kư̆m ưh pă jing Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm dơ̆ng.”

English: “Yet the number of the children of Israel Shall be as the sand of the sea, Which cannot be measured or numbered. And it shall come to pass In the place where it was said to them, ‘You are not My people,’ There it shall be said to them, ‘You are sons of the living God.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei ră kon sâu Isơrael gô jing lơ thoi chuơh cheng đak dơsĭ, ưh kơ kĕ kơ jô̆, pă kĕ tơng. Kơplah noh kơnh, ki Inh krao lu iĕm âu ưh pă trŏ kon pơlei Inh boih, na dang ei Inh gô krao lu iĕm jing kon Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă arih ling-lang.

English: Then the children of Judah and the children of Israel Shall be gathered together, And appoint for themselves one head; And they shall come up out of the land, For great will be the day of Jezreel!
Bahnar: Kon sâu Juđa păng kon sâu Isơrael gô pơgơ̆p băl; păng gô pơjing pôk minh 'nu pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng lu sư đơ̆ng noh lu sư gô rai lơ lăm teh đak noh, yua kơ năr Jêsreel noh năr tih tơpă.

English: Say to your brethren, ‘My people,’ And to your sisters, ‘Mercy is shown.’
Bahnar: “Krao bĕ kơ 'nhŏng oh lu iĕm: Ami kon pơlei Inh păng mŏ oh lu iĕm: Ruhama, Inh đei mơnat boih.

English: “Bring charges against your mother, bring charges; For she is not My wife, nor am I her Husband! Let her put away her harlotries from her sight, And her adulteries from between her breasts
Bahnar: Chrih bĕ kơ mĕ lu iĕm, chrih bĕ yua kơ sư noh ưh kơ sĭ akăn Inh, Inh kư̆m ưh kơ sĭ kơ klo sư! Sư athei hŭt lê̆ mă ataih tơdrong pơm pơyô kư̆ kă đơ̆ng sư tơdrong kơđang kơ̆l hơko đơ̆ng alam toh sư

English: Lest I strip her naked And expose her, as in the day she was born, And make her like a wilderness, And set her like a dry land, And slay her with thirst.
Bahnar: Tơdah ưh, kơnh Inh gô plôh lê̆ hơbĕn ao đơ̆ng sư lê̆ sư akâu hoh, thoi đe 'nao hơiơch kơ sư sơ̆; păng Inh pơm kơ sư thoi teh kro tơ char glă, pơm kơ sư lôch kơ rơhing.

English: “I will not have mercy on her children, For they are the children of harlotry.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m pă mơnat kơ lu kon sâu sư boih, yua kơ lu sư noh kon sâu đơ̆ng sư pơm pơyô kư̆ kă.

English: For their mother has played the harlot; She who conceived them has behaved shamefully. For she said, ‘I will go after my lovers, Who give me my bread and my water, My wool and my linen, My oil and my drink.’
Bahnar: Mĕ lu sư pơm boih pơyô kư̆ kă, anăp kơ lu sư hăm tơdrong mơlâu. Sư khan: Inh gô kiơ̆ lu pơyô inh, lu sư ăn kơ inh por sŏng đak nhă, che, sŏk triu, đak rơmă păng ăn kơ inh tơmam huch sa.

English: “Therefore, behold, I will hedge up your way with thorns, And wall her in, So that she cannot find her paths.
Bahnar: Thoi ei; 'nâu Inh gô iŏk jơla đăk trong sư, gô pơm dur găn sư, wă kơ sư chă trong rok ưh kơ đei dơ̆ng.

English: She will chase her lovers, But not overtake them; Yes, she will seek them, but not find them. Then she will say, ‘I will go and return to my first husband, For then it was better for me than now.’
Bahnar: Sư gô druh kiơ̆ pơyô so sư mă-lei ưh kơ tam, chă mă-lei ưh kơ tơ'bơ̆p. Đơ̆ng noh sư gô khan: ‘Inh gô wih tơ klo inh mă adrol; yua kơplah noh inh hiôk hloh kơ dang ei.’

English: For she did not know That I gave her grain, new wine, and oil, And multiplied her silver and gold— Which they prepared for Baal.
Bahnar: Sư ưh tam mă băt kơ Inh, Inh boih Tơ'ngla ăn kơ sư phe 'ba, sik 'nao păng đak rơmă noh, kư̆m ăn thim hu, maih lơ mă-lei lu sư pơyơ̆r ăn kơ yang Baal.

English: “Therefore I will return and take away My grain in its time And My new wine in its season, And will take back My wool and My linen, Given to cover her nakedness.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Inh gô pơdrâu iŏk phe 'ba Inh lăm bơyan kĕch, păng sik hơmu 'nao Inh lăm bơyan phĕ sư Inh pơdrâu iŏk che sŏk triu, păng che brai se mă sư yua pĕng akâu hoh sư.

English: Now I will uncover her lewdness in the sight of her lovers, And no one shall deliver her from My hand.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơdah tơdrong mơlâu sư, 'bơ̆t anăp lu pơyô sư, păng ưh kơ đei bu dŏng pơklaih sư đơ̆ng ti Inh.

English: I will also cause all her mirth to cease, Her feast days, Her New Moons, Her Sabbaths— All her appointed feasts.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơtôch lê̆ dôm tơdrong chơt hiôk sư, lu năr chơt hiôk tih lăm Khei 'Nao, năr pơdơh Sa'bat păng đĭ-đăng kơ năr giĕng tih lu sư.

English: “And I will destroy her vines and her fig trees, Of which she has said, ‘These are my wages that my lovers have given me.’ So I will make them a forest, And the beasts of the field shall eat them.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơrăm lê̆ lu tơm 'long hơra păng tơm 'long hơmu sư, noh sư khan: 'Nâu tơdrong apah đơ̆ng lu pơyô inh ăn kơ inh. Inh gô ăn kơ lu 'long sa plei gô jing thoi bri, păng lu sem bri gô sa.

English: I will punish her For the days of the Baals to which she burned incense. She decked herself with her earrings and jewelry, And went after her lovers; But Me she forgot,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô phak sư yua kơ lu năr mă sư soh pơyơ̆r 'long 'bâu phu kơ rup yang Baal, sư pơguăng đoh maih tơ đon 'bot kong păng dôm tơmam gĭt na năm kiơ̆ pơyô sư, na sư hiơt boih kơ Inh!” Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “Therefore, behold, I will allure her, Will bring her into the wilderness, And speak comfort to her.
Bahnar: Na, 'nâu, Inh gô pơlung sư, chông ba sư năm tơ tơmăn glă păng iŏk nơ̆r rơngơp pơma hăm sư.

English: I will give her her vineyards from there, And the Valley of Achor as a door of hope; She shall sing there, As in the days of her youth, As in the day when she came up from the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơdrâu kơ sư pơgar hơmu dơ̆ng, păng ăn thŭng Akôra jing 'măng tơdrong chang hơmĕng sư gô drơ̆ng Inh thoi năr sư oei hơmuh hơmŏng, păng kư̆m nhen thoi năr sư 'nao lĕch đơ̆ng Êyiptơ sơ̆.”

English: “And it shall be, in that day,” Says the LORD, “That you will call Me ‘My Husband,’ And no longer call Me ‘My Master,’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Lăm năr noh ih gô krao Inh: Klo inh; păng ưh pă krao Inh khan: Yang Baal inh dơ̆ng.

English: For I will take from her mouth the names of the Baals, And they shall be remembered by their name no more.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh gô iŏk lê̆ yang Baal đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r sư; wă kơ ưh pă đei bu 'blŏk krao anăn Baal dơ̆ng.

English: In that day I will make a covenant for them With the beasts of the field, With the birds of the air, And with the creeping things of the ground. Bow and sword of battle I will shatter from the earth, To make them lie down safely.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, Inh pơgơ̆p kon pơlei Inh hăm lu sem bri, lu sem păr păng lu hơdrông kơep mơmŏ kơpal teh Inh kư̆m gô gơ̆ lê̆ đĭ đao gưm, hră đơ̆ng lăm teh đak âu, pơgăn lê̆ lu tơdrong tơblah tơblŭng păng pơm ăn kơ kon pơlei tep pơdơh hiôk-hian.

English: “I will betroth you to Me forever; Yes, I will betroth you to Me In righteousness and justice, In lovingkindness and mercy
Bahnar: Inh gô oei kơ ih ling-lang hlŏng hloi; Inh gô tơ'bôh kơ ih tơdrong tơpăt sĭt trŏ 'blep iơ̆m dim păng 'mêm mơnat.

English: I will betroth you to Me in faithfulness, And you shall know the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơpă Inh gô tơ'bôh kơ ih tơdrong tơpăt sĭt, na ih gô băt kơ Kră Yang.

English: “It shall come to pass in that day That I will answer,” says the LORD; “I will answer the heavens, And they shall answer the earth.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lăm năr noh, Inh gô tơl tơwih kơ lu tăl plĕnh ăn hơmơ̆l, lu tăl plĕnh gô tơl tơwih kơ teh ăn 'mi.

English: The earth shall answer With grain, With new wine, And with oil; They shall answer Jezreel.
Bahnar: Teh gô tơl tơwih kơ 'ba mi, kơ sik 'nao, kơ đak rơmă, ăn đak 'mi păng lu tơmam âu gô tơl tơwih kơ Jêsreel.b

English: Then I will sow her for Myself in the earth, And I will have mercy on her who had not obtained mercy; Then I will say to those who were not My people, ‘You are My people!’ And they shall say, ‘You are my God!’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô rei pơtăm lu sư ăn kơ Inh lăm teh đak păng Inh gô 'mêm mơnat kơ lu bơngai âu mă Inh khan: “Lu sư bơngai mă Inh ưh kơ 'mêm mơnat.” Păng kơ lu bơngai mă Inh đei khan: Iĕm ưh kơ sĭ kon pơlei Inh. Inh gô khan: “Iĕm kon pơlei Inh.” Na lu sư gô tơl: “Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei nhôn.”

English: Then the LORD said to me, “Go again, love a woman who is loved by a lover and is committing adultery, just like the love of the LORD for the children of Israel, who look to other gods and love the raisin cakes of the pagans.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Năm 'mêm bĕ kơ akăn ih mă drŏ-kăn pơm đi, đei pơm pơyô boih; 'mêm kơ sư thoi Kră Yang oei 'mêm kơ kon pơlei Isơrael, mă khan lu sư kiơ̆ yang nai păng 'maih sa 'bĕng plei hơmu 'ngam.”

English: So I bought her for myself for fifteen shekels of silver, and one and one-half homers of barley.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Inh đei răt boih bơngai drŏ-kăn noh hăm mơjĭt-pơđăm sêkơla hu păng 'ba tơ'bâu minh hômerb minh puăt.

English: And I said to her, “You shall stay with me many days; you shall not play the harlot, nor shall you have a man—so, too, will I be toward you.”
Bahnar: Na inh khan kơ sư: Ih athei oei păng inh đunh năr; 'nĕ kơ pơm pơyô, dah chă oei klo nai, Inh pơm hăm ih thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: For the children of Israel shall abide many days without king or prince, without sacrifice or sacred pillar, without ephod or teraphim.
Bahnar: Bơngai Isơrael kư̆m oei lơ năr thoi noh, ưh kơ đei pơtao, ưh kơ đei yŏng pơgơ̆r, ưh kơ đei soi pơyơ̆r, ưh pă đei chơnang soi, ưh pă đei Ephot dah Thêraphin.

English: Afterward the children of Israel shall return and seek the LORD their God and David their king. They shall fear the LORD and His goodness in the latter days.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh lu bơngai Isơrael gô wih chơchă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư păng Đawit pơm pơtao lu sư. Lu sư gô wih brŏk păng hli tơrơ yom kơ Kră Yang păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng hiôk-hian lăm năr hơtuch kơnh.

English: Hear the word of the LORD, You children of Israel, For the LORD brings a charge against the inhabitants of the land: “There is no truth or mercy Or knowledge of God in the land.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu kon sâu Isơrael, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan yua kơ Kră Yang đei jô̆ hil boih kơ kon bơngai mă oei lăm teh đak âu. Ưh kơ đei bu tơpăt, ưh kơ đei bu băt 'mêm mơnat, păng ưh kơ đei bu băt hlôh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: By swearing and lying, Killing and stealing and committing adultery, They break all restraint, With bloodshed upon bloodshed.
Bahnar: Lăm noh pôm băt kơ pơm tơdrong hơlĕnh pơdăr, plêl, pơlôch băl, tơtông klĕ păng pơm pơyô kư̆ kă; lu sư pơm lơ tơdrong kơnê̆, pơlôch băl rai dêh pơm plơ̆ pham 'mong pham.

English: Therefore the land will mourn; And everyone who dwells there will waste away With the beasts of the field And the birds of the air; Even the fish of the sea will be taken away.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na lăm char âu đei ơh sơ'ngon, lu bơngai oei lăm noh rơmơ̆n rơmok, lu sem brem, lu sem păr kư̆m lei-lăi, ka lăm đak dơsĭ kư̆m lôch.

English: “Now let no man contend, or rebuke another; For your people are like those who contend with the priest.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh, iĕm 'nĕ tơ jô̆ băl, 'nĕ kơ tơchrih băl, 'nĕ kơ tơjâu băl ôh, Mă-lei Inh jô̆ iĕm yoch Ơ 'bok soi.

English: Therefore you shall stumble in the day; The prophet also shall stumble with you in the night; And I will destroy your mother.
Bahnar: Ih gô kơtơih kơ năr, kơmăng gah 'bok khan lê̆ adrol kư̆m gô kơtơih pơ̆k hăm ih păng Inh gô pơlôch mĕ ih.

English: My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge. Because you have rejected knowledge, I also will reject you from being priest for Me; Because you have forgotten the law of your God, I also will forget your children.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Inh răm boih yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ hlôh wao. Yua kơ ih sơngah boih kơ tơdrong băt hlôh, Inh kư̆m lei-lăi gô sơngah kơ ih na ih ưh pă jing bơngai khan lê̆ adrol dơ̆ng. Yua kơ ih hiơt boih tơdrong juăt Inh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, kư̆m lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n Inh kư̆m gô hiơt kơ kon sâu ih.

English: “The more they increased, The more they sinned against Me; I will change their glory into shame.
Bahnar: Lu sư hrôh rai lơ dang yơ, lu sư kư̆m pơm yoch hăm Inh dang noh. Inh gô tơplih tơdrong ư-ang lu sư jing tơdrong mơlâu.

English: They eat up the sin of My people; They set their heart on their iniquity.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'me rong lu sư kơdih hăm tơdrong yoch kon pơlei Inh, lu sư hưch ham kơ tơmam sa đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ kon pơlei Inh pơm.

English: And it shall be: like people, like priest. So I will punish them for their ways, And reward them for their deeds.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi jing thoi yơ Kon pơlei pơla Inh kư̆m jing thoi noh, Inh gô phak pơbral lu sư, kiơ̆ thoi trong lu sư pơm, păng kư̆m tơwih pơdrâu kơ lu sư thoi tơdrong jang đêl lu sư pơm.

English: For they shall eat, but not have enough; They shall commit harlotry, but not increase; Because they have ceased obeying the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô sŏng sa mă-lei ưh kơ phĭ. Lu sư gô pơm pơyô kư̆ kă mă-lei ưh pă đei hơ'lơ̆p; yua kơ lu sư achăng lê̆ boih Kră Yang, thoi noh 'maih pơm pơyô kư̆ kă.

English: “Harlotry, wine, and new wine enslave the heart.
Bahnar: Sik hơmu so păng sik hơmu 'nao pơm tơhiong lê̆ tơdrong hơgei lu sư.

English: My people ask counsel from their wooden idols, And their staff informs them. For the spirit of harlotry has caused them to stray, And they have played the harlot against their God.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Inh apinh yang rup pơm păng 'long, na 'long jra gô tơl lu sư; yua kơ jơhngơ̆m 'maih pơm kư̆ kă jing pơm kơ lu sư achăng lê̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư 'maih wă pơm pơyô kư̆ kă.

English: They offer sacrifices on the mountaintops, And burn incense on the hills, Under oaks, poplars, and terebinths, Because their shade is good. Therefore your daughters commit harlotry, And your brides commit adultery.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm yang kơpal kông, păng soh 'long 'bâu phu tơ kơpal groi, tơ ala tơm 'long kôih, 'long hơngo, 'long têrebin yua kơ đei yơ̆p rơngơp dêh. Yua kơ thoi noh na lu kon adruh lu iĕm pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, păng mŏ mai iĕm tơtông pơyô hăm đe nai.

English: “I will not punish your daughters when they commit harlotry, Nor your brides when they commit adultery; For the men themselves go apart with harlots, And offer sacrifices with a ritual harlot. Therefore people who do not understand will be trampled.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ phak lu kon adruh iĕm yua kơ yoch pơm pơyô, kư̆m ưh kơ phak lu mŏ mai iĕm yua kơ yoch ngôi hăm đe nai; yua kơ lu drŏ-nglo iĕm kư̆m ngôi kư̆ kă hăm lu drŏ-kăn đi, păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi hăm lu bơngai drŏ-kăn kư̆ kă. Thoi noh lu kon pơlei ưh kơ hlôh gô hiong răm.

English: “Though you, Israel, play the harlot, Let not Judah offend. Do not come up to Gilgal, Nor go up to Beth Aven, Nor swear an oath, saying, ‘As the LORD lives’
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai Isơrael, ih pơm pơyô kư̆ kă dêh, ơ bơngai Juđa kơchăng bĕ 'nĕ kơ pơm yoch thoi sư, 'nĕ kơ mơ̆t tơ anih Gilgal, kư̆m 'nĕ tŏk tơ pơlei Bêt Awen; 'nĕ pơkă hiap kơdih akâu khan. Tơpă mă thoi Kră Yang arih.

English: “For Israel is stubborn Like a stubborn calf; Now the LORD will let them forage Like a lamb in open country.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael kơchu thoi rơmo akăn kơchu, na thoi yơ Kră Yang wă 'me rong lu sư thoi kon triu lăm tơmăn 'nhĕt să.

English: “Ephraim is joined to idols, Let him alone.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Êphraim, pơgơ̆p hơdai rup yang, lê̆ măk ai sư.

English: Their drink is rebellion, They commit harlotry continually. Her rulers dearly love dishonor.
Bahnar: Wă sik lu sư đĭ boih, lu sư oei pơm pơyô kư̆ kă; lu kră pơgơ̆r lu sư lăp đon pơm tơdrong mơlâu.

English: The wind has wrapped her up in its wings, And they shall be ashamed because of their sacrifices.
Bahnar: Tơdrong thoi kial yua pơnăr sư gom lê̆ lu sư boih, lu sư gô mơlâu dêh kơ tơdrong lu sư pơm yang.

English: “Hear this, O priests! Take heed, O house of Israel! Give ear, O house of the king! For yours is the judgment, Because you have been a snare to Mizpah And a net spread on Tabor.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu 'bok soi, mơ̆ng bĕ lu tơdrong 'nâu. Ơ bơngai Isơrael, pơgling đon bĕ! Răp mơ̆ng bĕ, ơ bơngai lăm hnam pơtao! Tơdrong sek tơlang âu 'bơm trŏ kơ lu iĕm, yua kơ lu iĕm thoi hơđong hơ'năk lê̆ boih tơ pơlei Mispa; păng thoi hơnhuăl dăng boih tơ kông Tabôr.

English: The revolters are deeply involved in slaughter, Though I rebuke them all.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai âu jrok trong mơ̆t jrŭ tơ lăm tơdrong kơnê̆ boih. Mă-lei Inh gô bơtho pơjĭ đĭ-đăng lu sư.

English: I know Ephraim, And Israel is not hidden from Me; For now, O Ephraim, you commit harlotry; Israel is defiled.
Bahnar: Inh băt kơ khŭl Êphraim; păng lu bơngai Isơrael, ưh kơ hlơp kơ Inh ôh. Dang ei, ơ Êphraim, ih pơm pơyô ngôi kư̆ kă boih; păng lu bơngai Isơrael 'mê̆-'mach boih.

English: “They do not direct their deeds Toward turning to their God, For the spirit of harlotry is in their midst, And they do not know the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư pơm ưh kơ ăn lu sư wih tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư ôh. Yua kơ lu sư tơchĕng 'maih ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă. Lu sư jing ưh kơ băt kơ Kră Yang.

English: The pride of Israel testifies to his face; Therefore Israel and Ephraim stumble in their iniquity; Judah also stumbles with them.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơang lu bơngai Isơrael kơdranh blah lu sư; khŭl Isơrael, khŭl Êphraim gô pơ̆k huŏng yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư kơdih. Khŭl Juđa kư̆m gô pơ̆k huŏng hơdai hăm lu sư.

English: “With their flocks and herds They shall go to seek the LORD, But they will not find Him; He has withdrawn Himself from them.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô ba khŭl triu, khŭl rơmo lu sư, wă năm chă Kră Yang; mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh Sư ôh. Sư weh achăng lê̆ đơ̆ng lu sư boih.

English: They have dealt treacherously with the LORD, For they have begotten pagan children. Now a New Moon shall devour them and their heritage.
Bahnar: Lu sư oei arih sa ưh kơ tơpăt ôh hăm Kră Yang. Lu sư pŭ kon pôm đơ̆ng pơm pơyô kư̆ kă. Giĕng Khei 'Nao gô pơrăm sa pơđĭ lu sư lu sư hăm dêh char lu sư.

English: “Blow the ram’s horn in Gibeah, The trumpet in Ramah! Cry aloud at Beth Aven, ‘Look behind you, O Benjamin!’
Bahnar: Hlôm keng bĕ tơ pơlei Gibêah, Hlôm tơgiĕp tơ pơlei Rama. Ôr bĕ đei lu ayăt tơ pơlei Bêt Awen, ‘Ơ Bênjamin, nhôn tơ gah rŏng ih âu!

English: Ephraim shall be desolate in the day of rebuke; Among the tribes of Israel I make known what is sure.
Bahnar: Char Êphraim jing anih juơ lăm năr đei tơdrong bơtho pơjĭ; tơ adrĕch Isơrael Inh tơbăt tơdrong 'nâu truh sĭt.

English: “The princes of Judah are like those who remove a landmark; I will pour out My wrath on them like water.
Bahnar: Lu kră pơgơ̆r char Juđa jing thoi lu đe tơgar kơ hơdral; na Inh gô tuh tơdrong hil Inh thoi đak lơ̆p.

English: Ephraim is oppressed and broken in judgment, Because he willingly walked by human precept.
Bahnar: Đe pơjuă pơđep boih lu bơngai Êphraim, pơchah pơchek lu sư lăm năr sek tơlang, yua kơ lu sư lăp đon rơih boih kiơ̆ lu yang nai.

English: Therefore I will be to Ephraim like a moth, And to the house of Judah like rottenness.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na Inh jing thoi kơmot kuer sa Êphraim, kư̆m thoi yŏng bŭk sa adrĕch Juđa.

English: “When Ephraim saw his sickness, And Judah saw his wound, Then Ephraim went to Assyria And sent to King Jareb; Yet he cannot cure you, Nor heal you of your wound.
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai Êphraim 'bôh tơdrong jĭ lu sư, păng Juđa kư̆m 'bôh boih rơka lu sư, kơplah noh Êphraim năm tơ char Asiri, păng năm apinh pơtao tơm Jarep tơgŭm. Mă-lei sư ưh kơ gơh pơklaih lu iĕm ôh, păng kư̆m ưh kơ gơh ming hơmet rơka lu iĕm mơ̆n.

English: For I will be like a lion to Ephraim, And like a young lion to the house of Judah. I, even I, will tear them and go away; I will take them away, and no one shall rescue.
Bahnar: Inh gô jing thoi dăm-brang kơ lu bơngai Êphraim, thoi kon dăm-brang kơ bơngai Juđa. Inh boih gô kăp hek lu sư, na yak hloi tơ nai. Inh gô chông ba, ưh kơ đei bu gơh plah dŏng lu sư ôh.

English: I will return again to My place Till they acknowledge their offense. Then they will seek My face; In their affliction they will earnestly seek Me.”
Bahnar: Inh gô wih brŏk tơ anih Inh, dĭng truh tơ lu sư băt 'bôh lu sư đei yoch, na krao chă Inh, lăm năr pơmat-tat, lu sư gô adrin chă Inh. Tơdrong lu bơngai Isơrael tơbral. Hil chrih păng phak bơtho.

English: Come, and let us return to the LORD; For He has torn, but He will heal us; He has stricken, but He will bind us up.
Bahnar: Bĕ bơ̆n, jah wih brŏk tơ Kră Yang, Sư hek lê̆ lu bơ̆n boih, mă-lei Sư gô pơklaih bơ̆n; Sư đei teh pơjĭ bơ̆n, mă-lei Sư gô ming rơka noh.

English: After two days He will revive us; On the third day He will raise us up, That we may live in His sight.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'bar năr Sư gô pơrih bơ̆n; truh năr mă pêng Sư gô tơiung bơ̆n, na bơ̆n gô arih 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: Let us know, Let us pursue the knowledge of the LORD. His going forth is established as the morning; He will come to us like the rain, Like the latter and former rain to the earth.
Bahnar: Bĕ bơ̆n chơchă wă kơ băt Kră Yang. Ăn kơ bơ̆n băt kơnăl mă nhen Kră Yang. Tơdrong Sư truh sĭt tơpă thoi măt 'năr lĕch gah pơgê hrôih, Sư truh tơ lu bơ̆n thoi đak 'mi, thoi 'mi jur chruh kơ teh tuch-luch bơyan.

English: “O Ephraim, what shall I do to you? O Judah, what shall I do to you? For your faithfulness is like a morning cloud, And like the early dew it goes away.
Bahnar: Inh wă pơm liơ kơ lu iĕm, ơ bơngai Êphraim? Inh wă pơm liơ kơ lu iĕm, ơ bơngai Juđa? Iĕm 'mêm thoi tŭk pơgê hrôih, thoi đak ngom 'bônh kơ hrĕng.

English: Therefore I have hewn them by the prophets, I have slain them by the words of My mouth; And your judgments are like light that goes forth.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na Inh đei ăn boih lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol pơbral lu iĕm, Inh pơlôch boih lu iĕm hăm nơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Inh. Tơdrong Inh sek tơlang lĕch thoi hơdah măt 'năr lĕch.

English: For I desire mercy and not sacrifice, And the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
Bahnar: Inh wă kơ iĕm 'mêm mă sĭt, hloh kơ wă iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi. Wă kơ iĕm băt kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hloh, kơ wă ôh iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh.

English: “But like men they transgressed the covenant; There they dealt treacherously with Me.
Bahnar: Mă-lei thoi Ađam,a lu sư pơm glăi boih kơ đêl nơ̆r pơkă pơgơ̆p, thoi noh lu sư pă tơpăt boih kơ Inh.

English: Gilead is a city of evildoers And defiled with blood.
Bahnar: Gileat jơ̆ pơlei lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, jơ̆ng lu sư juă tă kơ pham ngăl.

English: As bands of robbers lie in wait for a man, So the company of priests murder on the way to Shechem; Surely they commit lewdness.
Bahnar: Thoi lu bơngai kơnê̆ răp lu bơngai yak rok trong ei, lu 'bok soi kư̆m wang pơm; thoi noh mơ̆n lu sư pơlôch bơngai rok trong năm tơ pơlei Sichem, tơpă lu sư pơm boih tơdrong kơnê̆ dêh!

English: I have seen a horrible thing in the house of Israel: There is the harlotry of Ephraim; Israel is defiled.
Bahnar: Lăm adrĕch Isơrael Inh 'bôh boih tơdrong kơnê̆ dêh, lu bơngai Êphraim pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, Isơrael 'mê̆-'mach boih!

English: Also, O Judah, a harvest is appointed for you, When I return the captives of My people.
Bahnar: Ơ Juđa, ih kư̆m lei-lăi, Inh đei hơmet ăn kơ iĕm boih năr Inh sek tơlang Layơ Inh wă dŏng pơklaih bơngai Isơrael.

English: “When I would have healed Israel, Then the iniquity of Ephraim was uncovered, And the wickedness of Samaria. For they have committed fraud; A thief comes in; A band of robbers takes spoil outside.
Bahnar: Layơ Inh wă pơklaih lu bơngai Isơrael, tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu bơngai Êphraim, păng tơdrong kơnê̆ lu bơngai Samari pơdah boih; lu sư hơlĕnh pơdăr, lu bơngai tơtông tơ lăm, lu bơngai rôp tơgar iŏk tơ rok trong.

English: They do not consider in their hearts That I remember all their wickedness; Now their own deeds have surrounded them; They are before My face.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ tơchĕng ôh kơ Inh oei 'blŏk kơ đĭ-đăng tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư pơm. Tơdrong yoch lu sư pơm wang tăp dăr kơ lu sư, tơdrong lu sư pơm oei 'bơ̆t anăp Inh.

English: They make a king glad with their wickedness, And princes with their lies.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm tơdrong yoch wă pơhiôk kơ pơtao, păng yua tơdrong hơlĕnh lu sư pơhiôk lu kră pơgơ̆r.

English: “They are all adulterers. Like an oven heated by a baker— He ceases stirring the fire after kneading the dough, Until it is leavened.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu sư tă kơ pơm pơyô kư̆ kă ngăl. Lu sư jing thoi tơnuh ŭnh tŏ mă đe tơkuh wă 'buh 'bĕng, bơngai 'buh 'bĕng tơkuh pơgơ̆p ŭnh iŏk đơ̆ng 'nao jrâu tơpŭng bơlah dĭng truh tơ bơlah pông.

English: In the day of our king Princes have made him sick, inflamed with wine; He stretched out his hand with scoffers.
Bahnar: Dĭng 'bơ̆t năr pơtao lu bơ̆n hơmet sŏng sa hơdai, lu kră pơgơ̆r suai yua kơ đơ̆ng huch sik hơmu lơ. Pơtao kư̆m rôp ti hơdai hăm lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: They prepare their heart like an oven, While they lie in wait; Their baker sleeps all night; In the morning it burns like a flaming fire.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơgơ̆p jơhngơ̆m lu sư wă pơm kơnê̆ tơtŏ thoi tơnuh ŭnh; lu bơngai 'buh 'bĕng, khưi prăt măng bơngai 'buh 'bĕng tep truh pơgê hrôih na tơnuh ŭnh khơ̆ng thoi pla ŭnh.

English: They are all hot, like an oven, And have devoured their judges; All their kings have fallen. None among them calls upon Me.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu sư tơtŏ thoi tơnuh ŭnh, đơ̆ng noh sa lu kră sek tơlang, đĭ-đăng pơtao lu sư huŏng boih mă-lei ưh kơ đei bu lăm lu sư krao chă Inh.

English: “Ephraim has mixed himself among the peoples; Ephraim is a cake unturned.
Bahnar: Khŭl lu bơngai Êphraim tơmơ̆t lu sư kơdih hăm khŭl bơngai nai, bơngai Êphraim kư̆m thoi 'bĕng mi đe 'buh tam mă plơ̆.

English: Aliens have devoured his strength, But he does not know it; Yes, gray hairs are here and there on him, Yet he does not know it.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơmoi tơhiong lê̆ boih tơdrong pran kơtang lu sư, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ băt tơdrong noh! Kơ̆l lu sư đĭ sŏk ko boih, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ 'bôh.

English: And the pride of Israel testifies to his face, But they do not return to the LORD their God, Nor seek Him for all this.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơang lu bơngai Isơrael pơdah tơbăt boih 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư kơdih, lu sư đei tơ'bơ̆p dôm tơdrong noh ră, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ wă wih brŏk tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư kơdih, păng kư̆m ưh kơ chơchă Kră Yang.

English: “Ephraim also is like a silly dove, without sense— They call to Egypt, They go to Assyria.
Bahnar: Êphraim thoi sem kơtơp kơwao, ưh kơ đei đon băt hlôh, lu sư krao apinh char Êyiptơ, năm tơ char Asiri.

English: Wherever they go, I will spread My net on them; I will bring them down like birds of the air; I will chastise them According to what their congregation has heard.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư năm tơ noh Inh gô dăng kơ lu sư hơnhuăl, Inh gô pơm kơ lu sư hrơ̆p hơnhuăl thoi lu sem păr; Inh gô phak lu sư kiơ̆ thoi khŭl lu mă đei kơtơ̆ng lu sư pơm kơnê̆.

English: “Woe to them, for they have fled from Me! Destruction to them, Because they have transgressed against Me! Though I redeemed them, Yet they have spoken lies against Me.
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ lu sư yua kơ lu sư tơklah ataih đơ̆ng Inh; Inh gô pơrăm lu sư yua kơ lu sư pơm yoch boih hăm Inh. Mă khan Inh wă dêh ră pơklaih lu sư, mă-lei lu sư pơma hơlĕnh kơ Inh.

English: They did not cry out to Me with their heart When they wailed upon their beds. “They assemble together for grain and new wine, They rebel against Me
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ đei krao ôr chơchă Inh đơ̆ng lăm jơhngơ̆m, mă-lei lu sư oei ôr krao kơtă kơpal giơng tep lu sư, lu sư akŭm pơpôi 'ba păng sik hơmu păng lu sư achăng lê̆ Inh boih.

English: Though I disciplined and strengthened their arms, Yet they devise evil against Me
Bahnar: Inh boih pơhrăm pơjuăt, đei pơm kơ kơkŏng ti lu sư pran. Mă-lei lu sư kư̆m oei 'maih pơm kơnê̆ kơ Inh 'mơ̆i.

English: They return, but not to the Most High; They are like a treacherous bow. Their princes shall fall by the sword For the cursings of their tongue. This shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Lu sư wih brŏk mă-lei ưh kơ tơklă tơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, lu sư kư̆m thoi hră đe prah rĕng tơ nai. Lu kră pơgơ̆r lu sư gô pơ̆k lôch kơ đao gưm, yua kơ hơpiĕt lu sư pơma hơlĕnh. Tơdrong noh pơm kơ đe hiĕk ăr che bơle kơ lu sư tơ lăm char Êyiptơ.

English: “Set the trumpet to your mouth! He shall come like an eagle against the house of the LORD, Because they have transgressed My covenant And rebelled against My law.
Bahnar: Dan bĕ tơgiĕp 'bơ̆t 'bơ̆r ih! Lu ayăt thoi sem grơ̆ năm blah bơngai Kră Yang, yua kơ kon pơlei pơm glăi boih kơ đêl nơ̆r pơgơ̆p, păng pơm yoch kơ tơdrong juăt Inh.

English: Israel will cry to Me, ‘My God, we know You!’
Bahnar: Lu sư gô ôr krao Inh: ‘Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei nhôn, lu nhôn kon Isơrael băt kơnăl kơ ih!’

English: Israel has rejected the good; The enemy will pursue him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai Isơrael sơngah boih kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, na lu ayăt gô druh lu sư.

English: “They set up kings, but not by Me; They made princes, but I did not acknowledge them. From their silver and gold They made idols for themselves— That they might be cut off.
Bahnar: Lu sư pôk boih pơtao kơdih mă ưh kơ trŏ đơ̆ng Inh, lu sư kư̆m rơih iŏk lu bơngai pơgơ̆r mă-lei kư̆m ưh kơ đei pơdrơ̆ng inh. Lu sư iŏk jên hu, maih lu sư man boih rup yang jing tơdrong pơrăm blơ̆ lu sư kơdih.

English: Your calf is rejected, O Samaria! My anger is aroused against them— How long until they attain to innocence?
Bahnar: Ơ Samari, Inh hŭt lê̆ boih rup kon rơmo ih; Inh hil mĭl blah boih lu sư; ưh kơ băt đunh dang yơ lu sư gô chă tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: For from Israel is even this: A workman made it, and it is not God; But the calf of Samaria shall be broken to pieces.
Bahnar: Rup kon rơmo noh đơ̆ng minh 'nu bơngai Isơrael pơm; noh ưh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh. Sĭt, rup kon rơmo lu bơngai Samari đe gô teh pơchah đĭ.

English: “They sow the wind, And reap the whirlwind. The stalk has no bud; It shall never produce meal. If it should produce, Aliens would swallow it up.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư rei boih kial, lu sư gô yuă iŏk hơbŭt tih; tơm 'ba lu sư oei dơ̆ng, mă-lei pă đei hnông, 'ba lu sư ưh pă đei găr pă jing phe; mă khan đei găr ră mă-lei lu bơngai tơmoi gô luăn sa đĭ.

English: Israel is swallowed up; Now they are among the Gentiles Like a vessel in which is no pleasure.
Bahnar: Đe luăn sa bơngai Isơrael boih, dang ei lu sư oei tŏk-bŏk hăm kon bơngai thoi pơnhan tơmam ưh kơ gĭt.

English: For they have gone up to Assyria, Like a wild donkey alone by itself; Ephraim has hired lovers.
Bahnar: Lu sư tŏk boih tơ dêh Asiri, thoi minh pôm aseh iĕ bri chă hoang hơdrô̆; lu bơngai Êphraim tĕch lu sư boih tơ lu bơngai pơm pơyô kư̆ kă mă lu sư hưch.

English: Yes, though they have hired among the nations, Now I will gather them; And they shall sorrow a little, Because of the burden of the king of princes.
Bahnar: Mă khan lu sư tĕch boih lu sư kơdih kơ adrĕch adrung bơngai nai, mă-lei Inh oei akŭm lu sư; păng lu sư rai huach yua kơ đơ̆ng pơtao kơtang pơjuă pơđep lu sư.

English: “Because Ephraim has made many altars for sin, They have become for him altars for sinning.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Êphraim pơm rai đei lơ chơnang soi huai đơ̆ng yoch; na đơ̆ng dôm chơnang soi noh tơhuŏng lu sư lăm tơdrong yoch.

English: I have written for him the great things of My law, But they were considered a strange thing.
Bahnar: Inh đei chih ăn boih tơdrong juăt Inh lơ, mă-lei lu sư lăng thoi tơdrong mă lu sư ưh kơ hlôh.

English: For the sacrifices of My offerings they sacrifice flesh and eat it, But the LORD does not accept them. Now He will remember their iniquity and punish their sins. They shall return to Egypt.
Bahnar: Mă khan lu sư soi pơyơ̆r kơ Inh, păng sa sĕch 'nhĕm noh, Kră Yang ưh kơ hiôk ôh kơ lu sư. Na Kră Yang 'blŏk kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ đêl lu sư pơm, păng gô phak pơjĭ lu sư yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư pơm; lu sư gô wih brŏk tơ dêh Êyiptơ.

English: “For Israel has forgotten his Maker, And has built temples; Judah also has multiplied fortified cities; But I will send fire upon his cities, And it shall devour his palaces.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael hiơt boih kơ Tơ'ngla pơjing lu sư, păng đei pơdơ̆ng lu hnam pơtao, Juđa kư̆m đei thim lơ pơlei tih đei dur kơjăp, mă-lei Inh gô ăn ŭnh truh sa tơ pơlei tih, păng ŭnh 'noh soh chhông sa lu kơđông kơjăp lu sư.

English: Do not rejoice, O Israel, with joy like other peoples, For you have played the harlot against your God. You have made love for hire on every threshing floor.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ chhôk hal. Ơ bơngai Isơrael! 'Nĕ kơ chơt hiôk dêh thoi adrĕch adrung nai! Ih achăng lê̆ boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm. Păng pơm kơnê̆, pơm pơyô kư̆ kă boih, Lăp đon boih iŏk drŏ-kăn đi tơ jơ̆p-jang anih preh 'ba.

English: The threshing floor and the winepress Shall not feed them, And the new wine shall fail in her.
Bahnar: Anih preh 'ba păng hơlŭng chơpĕt đak hơmu ưh kơ đei rong lu sư ôh; sik plei hơmu 'nao lu sư gô ưh kơmah.

English: They shall not dwell in the LORD’s land, But Ephraim shall return to Egypt, And shall eat unclean things in Assyria.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ gơh oei ôh tơ lăm char Kră Yang; mă-lei Êphraim gô wih brŏk tơ char Êyiptơ, lu sư gô sa tơmam sa ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng rơgoh lăm char Asiri.

English: They shall not offer wine offerings to the LORD, Nor shall their sacrifices be pleasing to Him. It shall be like bread of mourners to them; All who eat it shall be defiled. For their bread shall be for their own life; It shall not come into the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m ưh pă đei tuh pơyơ̆r boih sik hơmu kơ Kră Yang, păng dôm tơmam soi lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ pơm kơ Kră Yang hiôk ôh, mă-lei jing thoi 'bĕng mi đe sa nhơ̆m hmoi ơh sơ'ngon kơ bơngai lôch, đĭ-đăng lu bơngai sa 'bĕng noh jing 'mê̆-'mach, yua kơ 'bĕng mi noh 'măn kơ lu sư kơdih đĕch 'bĕng noh ưh kơ truh ôh tơ hnam Kră Yang.

English: What will you do in the appointed day, And in the day of the feast of the LORD?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm wă pơm liơ kơ lăm năr et sa tih noh lăm năr giĕng kơ Kră Yang?

English: For indeed they are gone because of destruction. Egypt shall gather them up; Memphis shall bury them. Nettles shall possess their valuables of silver; Thorns shall be in their tents.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu sư kơdâu ôn đơ̆ng đe pơrăm, char Êyiptơ gô rôp akŭm pơđĭ lu sư, păng pơlei Memphis gô 'bŭ lê̆ lu sư. Lu tơmam gĭt pơm păng hu lu sư gô gom lê̆ hăm jơla bơmrôm, lu jơla gô chăt lăm bơsŭn lu sư.

English: The days of punishment have come; The days of recompense have come. Israel knows! The prophet is a fool, The spiritual man is insane, Because of the greatness of your iniquity and great enmity.
Bahnar: Năr wă phak lu sư truh boih, năr wă pơm 'mong lu sư truh boih! Ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael athei băt tơdrong noh. Yua kơ tơdrong yoch iĕm tih dêh, Păng tơdrong lu iĕm hil mĭl kư̆m tih dêh, Iĕm lăng lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol thoi bơngai kơhlôh kơwao, thoi bơngai yang mơ̆t jing wơnh

English: The watchman of Ephraim is with my God; But the prophet is a fowler’s snare in all his ways— Enmity in the house of his God.
Bahnar: 'Bok khan lê̆ adrol jơ̆ bơngai wei-lăng bơngai wei Êphraim Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei athei; Iĕm pơm kơ 'Bok khan lê̆ adrol thoi hơnhuăl đe wŏk rôp sem păr oei jơ̆p kơ trong sư, kư̆m hil areh kơ sư lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư.

English: They are deeply corrupted, As in the days of Gibeah. He will remember their iniquity; He will punish their sins.
Bahnar: Khŭl Isơrael pơ̆k huŏng răm jrŭ dêh tơpă lăm tơdrong kơnê̆, kư̆m dang tơdrong kơnê̆ lăm pơlei Gibêah. Kră Yang gô 'blŏk kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư, na gô phak pơbral lu sư yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư.

English: “I found Israel Like grapes in the wilderness; I saw your fathers As the firstfruits on the fig tree in its first season. But they went to Baal Peor, And separated themselves to that shame; They became an abomination like the thing they loved.
Bahnar: Lăp Inh 'bôh boih khŭl Isơrael, lu sư thoi hơie plei hơmu tơ lăm char glă. Lăp Inh 'bôh boih 'bok lu iĕm lu sư thoi plei hơra đum blŭng-a lăm bơyan plei; mă-lei lăp lu sư năm mơ̆t boih lăm anih Baal Pêôr; lu sư jao lu sư kơdih kơ rup yang Baal mơlâu kơdơ̆, na lu sư jing tơmam mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hil areh thoi rup yang lu sư mă lu sư 'mêm.

English: As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird— No birth, no pregnancy, and no conception!
Bahnar: Tơdrong ư-ang lu bơngai Êphraim gô păr jăk thoi sem; ưh pă tơpŭ kon, pă đei pơjing hơ'lơ̆p, kư̆m ưh pă đei anăp dơ̆ng!

English: Though they bring up their children, Yet I will bereave them to the last man. Yes, woe to them when I depart from them!
Bahnar: Mă khan lu sư 'me rong lu kon hơ'lơ̆p, Inh gô pơlôch lê̆ đĭ-đăng pă đei bu oei arih dơ̆ng. Răm-'băm dêh kơ lu sư. Mưh inh achăng lê̆ lu sư!

English: Just as I saw Ephraim like Tyre, planted in a pleasant place, So Ephraim will bring out his children to the murderer.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Êphraim thoi inh đei rơih boih plei đe pơtăm boih lăm teh jing 'lơ̆ng thoi Tir. Mă-lei bơngai Êphraim gô chông anhăk ba kon sâu lu sư tơ anih đe pơlôch pơrăm.

English: Give them, O LORD— What will You give? Give them a miscarrying womb And dry breasts!
Bahnar: Ăn bĕ kơ lu sư, Ơ Kră Yang, Kră Yang Ih gô ăn kơ lu sư kiơ: Ăn kơ klak lu sư lăr 'bônh kơ huŏng, ăn kơ toh lu sư kro ưh kơ đei đak toh.

English: “All their wickedness is in Gilgal, For there I hated them. Because of the evil of their deeds I will drive them from My house; I will love them no more. All their princes are rebellious.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng tơdrong kơnê̆, tơdrong yoch lu sư pơdah boih tơ pơlei Gilgal, Inh đei hil kơ lu sư boih. Yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư pơm Inh gô pơpuh lê̆ lu sư đơ̆ng hnam Inh. Inh ưh pă 'mêm kơ lu sư dơ̆ng, đĭ-đăng lu yŏng sư kư̆m gô ayăt kơ Inh.

English: Ephraim is stricken, Their root is dried up; They shall bear no fruit. Yes, were they to bear children, I would kill the darlings of their womb.”
Bahnar: Inh ăn kơ rơh Êphraim, kro boih, lu sư ưh pă đei plei dơ̆ng boih, mă khan lu sư pơjing kon hơ'lơ̆p, Inh gô pơlôch lê̆ đĭ kon lu sư mă 'mêm kơeng đơ̆ng blu pôih.

English: My God will cast them away, Because they did not obey Him; And they shall be wanderers among the nations.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh gô hŭt lê̆ lu sư yua kơ lu sư kuă kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang na lu sư gô jing bơngai chă thông măng jơ̆p kơ dêh char nai.

English: Israel empties his vine; He brings forth fruit for himself. According to the multitude of his fruit He has increased the altars; According to the bounty of his land They have embellished his sacred pillars.
Bahnar: Bơngai Isơrael sơ̆ thoi minh tơnơm hơmu hơdrih 'lơ̆ng, plei sư trem. Lăp plei sư rai trem lơ, lu sư kư̆m pơdơ̆ng chơnang soi rai lơ; kiơ̆ thoi lu sư chăt rai lơ rai mơdrŏng lăm char sư, lu sư pơm rup yang rai lơ thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: Their heart is divided; Now they are held guilty. He will break down their altars; He will ruin their sacred pillars.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m lu sư jing tơklah 'bar, na dang ei lu sư gô pŭ tơdrong pơmat yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư Kră Yang gô teh tơlơ̆ lê̆ chơnang soi, păng gô pơrăm lê̆ rup yang lu sư.

English: For now they say, “We have no king, Because we did not fear the LORD. And as for a king, what would he do for us?”
Bahnar: Tơpă lu sư gô khan: Lu bơ̆n ưh kơ đei pơtao yua kơ lu bơ̆n ưh kơ hli yom kơ Kră Yang; mă đei pơtao sư gơh tơgŭm kơ lu bơ̆n kiơ?

English: They have spoken words, Swearing falsely in making a covenant. Thus judgment springs up like hemlock in the furrows of the field.
Bahnar: Lu sư chă pơma pơkă pơkăm hơlĕnh lăm nơ̆r pơgơ̆p, Thoi noh tơdrong lu sư. Jing thoi 'nhĕt kơnê̆ hơkăm chăt rok trong đêl choh lăm chŭn.

English: The inhabitants of Samaria fear Because of the calf of Beth Aven. For its people mourn for it, And its priests shriek for it— Because its glory has departed from it.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei oei lăm char Kon pơlei Samari hli, yua kơ rup yang kon rơmo Bêt Awen hiong boih, kon pơlei ơh sơ'ngon yua rup yang noh, păng lu 'bok soi kư̆m nhơ̆m ơh 'mêm kơ rup kon rơmo 'lơ̆ng rŏ noh, yua kơ rup yang noh ưh pă đei boih.

English: The idol also shall be carried to Assyria As a present for King Jareb. Ephraim shall receive shame, And Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.
Bahnar: Sĭt tơpă đe gô tung ba rup 'noh tơ char Asiri pơm tơmam thuê̆ pơyơ̆r ăn kơ pơtao tơm Jarep. Lu bơngai Êphraim kơdơ̆, lu bơngai Isơrael gô mơlâu kơdih akâu.

English: As for Samaria, her king is cut off Like a twig on the water.
Bahnar: Char Samari gô hiong hơdai hăm pơtao sư hiong hach thoi blôk kơpal đak.

English: Also the high places of Aven, the sin of Israel, Shall be destroyed. The thorn and thistle shall grow on their altars; They shall say to the mountains, “Cover us!” And to the hills, “Fall on us!”
Bahnar: Lu anih kơjung tơ Awen, wă khan anih đei tơdrong yoch lu bơngai Isơrael, đe gô pơrăm đĭ, 'long jơla, păng jơla bơmrôm gô chăt hro tơ kơpal chơnang soi lu sư. Kơplah noh lu sư gô khan kơ kông: Klơ̆p lê̆ nhôn bĕ păng khan kơ lu groi. Gom đơ̆p lê̆ lu nhôn bĕ!

English: “O Israel, you have sinned from the days of Gibeah; There they stood. The battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity Did not overtake them.
Bahnar: Ơ Isơrael, lu iĕm pơm yoch boih đơ̆ng năr iĕm pơm kơnê̆ tơ pơlei Gibêah! Lu iĕm oei pơm yoch ngăl, Hăm trŏ tơdrong tơblah tih hăm lu kon bơngai yoch kơnê̆ tơ pơlei Gibêah gô truh tơ iĕm?

English: When it is My desire, I will chasten them. Peoples shall be gathered against them When I bind them for their two transgressions.
Bahnar: Layơ Inh wă, Inh gô phak pơjĭ lu sư; păng lu dêh đe gô iung blah phak lu sư, yua kơ lu sư đei pơm yoch 'bar hơtăl.

English: Ephraim is a trained heifer That loves to thresh grain; But I harnessed her fair neck, I will make Ephraim pull a plow. Judah shall plow; Jacob shall break his clods.”
Bahnar: Êphraim thoi minh pôm kon rơmo adruh đĭ pơjuăt boih, wă pơjuă 'ba; mă-lei Inh gô dan 'long ăt tơ kơpal hơko bek 'lơ̆ng sư. Inh gô ăn kơ đe hao kơpal hơko Êphraim; na Juđa gô rơuơ păng Jakôp gô preh pơhĕch teh kơ sư kơdih.

English: Sow for yourselves righteousness; Reap in mercy; Break up your fallow ground, For it is time to seek the LORD, Till He comes and rains righteousness on you.
Bahnar: Rei bĕ lu iĕm kơdih hăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, yuă iŏk bĕ plei đơ̆ng tơdrong 'mêm sĭt, choh bĕ teh lu iĕm mă lê̆ bri! Truh boih jơ chă Kră Yang, dĭng truh tơ Sư ăn jur tơdrong tơpăt thoi đak 'mi tơ lu iĕm.

English: You have plowed wickedness; You have reaped iniquity. You have eaten the fruit of lies, Because you trusted in your own way, In the multitude of your mighty men.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm choh rơuơ boih tơdrong kơnê̆, lu iĕm yuă iŏk boih tơdrong kơnê̆ boih, lu iĕm sa plei đơ̆ng tơdrong hơlĕnh pơdăr. Yua kơ lu iĕm gơnang boih kơ trong lu iĕm kơdih, păng lu linh pran kơtang lu iĕm.

English: Therefore tumult shall arise among your people, And all your fortresses shall be plundered As Shalman plundered Beth Arbel in the day of battle— A mother dashed in pieces upon her children.
Bahnar: Tơdrong tơblah tơblŭng ơ-ôs ơ-as gô pơm kơ kon pơlei iĕm, đe gô pơrăm dôm lu pơlei kơđông kơjăp lu iĕm, thoi Salman pơrăm pơlei Bêt Arbel lăm năr tơblah băl. Mă đe đei teh pơlôch mĕ hơdai hăm lu kon sư.

English: Thus it shall be done to you, O Bethel, Because of your great wickedness. At dawn the king of Israel Shall be cut off utterly.
Bahnar: Ơ Bethel đe kư̆m gô pơm kơ lu iĕm thoi noh, yua kơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu iĕm tih dêh. Đe gô pơlôch Pơtao Isơrael lăp 'brưch hơdah til pơgê lăm năr noh kơnh.

English: “When Israel was a child, I loved him, And out of Egypt I called My son.
Bahnar: Kơplah Isơrael oei 'lơ̆p, Inh 'mêm dêh kơ lu sư, păng Inh krao kon drŏ-nglo Inh lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ.

English: As they called them, So they went from them; They sacrificed to the Baals, And burned incense to carved images.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael Inh rai krao lu sư, lu sư rai kơdâu ôn ataih đơ̆ng Inh; lu sư kư̆m oei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ rup yang Baal, păng kư̆m oei soh 'long 'bâu phu kơ lu rup yang nai.

English: “I taught Ephraim to walk, Taking them by their arms; But they did not know that I healed them.
Bahnar: Mă khan lei ră, Inh boih pơhrăm bơngai Êphraim gơh yak nơnăm, iŏk ti lu sư na tơiung păng pơklaih lu sư, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ băt ôh.

English: I drew them with gentle cords, With bands of love, And I was to them as those who take the yoke from their neck. I stooped and fed them.
Bahnar: Inh đei yua boih tơdrong mơnat thoi tơlei akar, păng yua tơlei tơ̆n akar tơdrong 'mêm dui lu sư. Inh plôh lê̆ boih 'long ăt trăp đơ̆ng hơko lu sư, păng drap pôk ăn tơmam sa 'me 'bơ̆t 'bơ̆r lu sư.

English: “He shall not return to the land of Egypt; But the Assyrian shall be his king, Because they refused to repent.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh pă wih hơlơ̆k tơ dêh char Êyiptơ dơ̆ng, mă-lei bơngai Asiri gô pơm pơtao lu sư, yua kơ lu sư arăng kơ̆l ưh kơ wă wih brŏk tơ Inh.

English: And the sword shall slash in his cities, Devour his districts, And consume them, Because of their own counsels.
Bahnar: Đe gô pơrăm tơ rim pơlei lu sư hăm đao gưm, pơrăm lê̆ 'long chơkăl 'măng jang lu sư, pơlôch lu sư yua kơ tơdrong lu sư chă đon kơnê̆.

English: My people are bent on backsliding from Me. Though they call to the Most High, None at all exalt Him.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei Inh pơkă wă achăng lê̆ Inh ngơ-ngei khan đe krao lu sư wih tơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, ưh kơ đei bu iung wih.

English: “How can I give you up, Ephraim? How can I hand you over, Israel? How can I make you like Admah? How can I set you like Zeboiim? My heart churns within Me; My sympathy is stirred.
Bahnar: Ơ Êphraim, liơ Inh gơh achăng ih, Ơ Isơrael, liơ Inh gơh jao lê̆ lu iĕm kơ đe? Liơ Inh gơh ăn pơm kơ lu iĕm jing thoi pơlei Atma, dah liơ Inh gơh pơm kơ lu iĕm thoi pơlei Sêbôim? Jơhngơ̆m Inh sơngah ưh kơ wă pơm tơdrong noh păng jơhngơ̆m Inh 'mêm kơeng đĭ tơtŏ dêh boih.

English: I will not execute the fierceness of My anger; I will not again destroy Ephraim. For I am God, and not man, The Holy One in your midst; And I will not come with terror.
Bahnar: Inh pơgơ̆t jơhngơ̆m tơtŏ Inh, păng Inh ưh kơ wă pơlôch pơrăm boih Êphraim, Yua kơ Inh jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, ưh kơ trŏ kon bơngai ôh. Inh Tơ'ngla rơgoh 'lơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm, ưh kơ wă hil pơrăm lu iĕm ôh.

English: “They shall walk after the LORD. He will roar like a lion. When He roars, Then His sons shall come trembling from the west
Bahnar: Sư gô grĕnh thoi dăm-brang, na lu bơngai Isơrael gô kiơ̆ rŏng Kră Yang, mưh Sư arum, na kon sâu Sư đơ̆ng gah bơmơ̆t gô truh hli tơtơ̆.

English: They shall come trembling like a bird from Egypt, Like a dove from the land of Assyria. And I will let them dwell in their houses,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô hli tơtơ̆ wih đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ thoi sem păr, thoi sem pơgâm đơ̆ng char Asiri, păng Inh tơbrŏk lu sư tơ hnam lu sư kơdih Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “Ephraim has encircled Me with lies, And the house of Israel with deceit; But Judah still walks with God, Even with the Holy One who is faithful.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Êphraim hơlĕnh kơ Inh lu kon pơlei Isơrael pơm plơ̆ plĕch. Mă-lei lu bơngai Juđa oei kiơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, oei kiơ̆ Tơ'ngla 'lơ̆ng rơgoh tơpă sĭt.

English: “Ephraim feeds on the wind, And pursues the east wind; He daily increases lies and desolation. Also they make a covenant with the Assyrians, And oil is carried to Egypt.
Bahnar: Êphraim 'me sư kơdih hăm kial, kơdâu kiơ̆ kial đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch rim năr, lu sư pơma hơlĕnh roi dêh păng pơm rai lơ tơdrong kơnê̆; lu sư pơgơ̆p hăm char Asiri păng chĕp ba đak rơmă ôliwơ tơ char Êyiptơ.

English: “The LORD also brings a charge against Judah, And will punish Jacob according to his ways; According to his deeds He will recompense him.
Bahnar: Kră Yang kư̆m đei pơma chrih kơ adrĕch Juđa, păng Sư gô phak Jakôp kiơ̆ thoi kơ trong sư yak năm; Kră Yang gô pơm tơwih kơ lu sư kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong lu sư pơm.

English: He took his brother by the heel in the womb, And in his strength he struggled with God.
Bahnar: Oei lăm klak mĕ sư, Jakôp rôp kơnơl jơ̆ng 'nhŏng sư; păng truh tơ 'lŏ tơ̆l, sư tơglơ̆m hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Yes, he struggled with the Angel and prevailed; He wept, and sought favor from Him. He found Him in Bethel, And there He spoke to us
Bahnar: Sư đei tơglơ̆m hăm linh jang 'lơ̆ng, păng jei sư; sư nhơ̆m păng krao hơdrĭ apinh Kră Yang mơnat ăn. Sư tơ'bơ̆p boih Kră Yang tơ pơlei Bethel păng tơ noh Kră Yang đei bơtho sư.

English: That is, the LORD God of hosts. The LORD is His memorable name.
Bahnar: Noh jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh; anăn mă đe ư-ang sư boih Kră Yang.

English: So you, by the help of your God, return; Observe mercy and justice, And wait on your God continually.
Bahnar: Wih brŏk bĕ tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'mêm mơnat păng oei pơm tơdrong tơpăt, păng chang gô bĕ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ling-lang.

English: “A cunning Canaanite! Deceitful scales are in his hand; He loves to oppress.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael thoi bơngai mơdro chĕp 'long kŏng hơlĕnh lăm ti sư, sư 'maih chă sa pơgâm đe.

English: And Ephraim said, ‘Surely I have become rich, I have found wealth for myself; In all my labors They shall find in me no iniquity that is sin.’
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Êphraim pơang akâu kơdih khan: Sĭt tơpă Inh jing bơngai mơdrŏng, inh đei mŭk lơ. Lăm đĭ dôm tơdrong jang mă Inh pơm ưh kơ đe 'bôh minh tơdrong jang kiơ khan yoch kơnê̆.

English: “But I am the LORD your God, Ever since the land of Egypt; I will again make you dwell in tents, As in the days of the appointed feast.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm đơ̆ng năr iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ; Inh gô ăn kơ lu iĕm oei tơ lăm bơsŭn dơ̆ng kư̆m thoi lăm năr pơm hơmet sŏng sa tih sơ̆.

English: I have also spoken by the prophets, And have multiplied visions; I have given symbols through the witness of the prophets.”
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m đei khan boih kơ lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol; Inh boih đei ăn thim tơdrong tơ'bôh, păng Inh kư̆m đei ăn lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol pơtruh nơ̆r pơtih gia đơ̆ng Inh.

English: Though Gilead has idols— Surely they are vanity— Though they sacrifice bulls in Gilgal, Indeed their altars shall be heaps in the furrows of the field.
Bahnar: Gileat kơnê̆ tơpă, lu sư ưh kơ yua kiơ. Lu sư pơm yang hăm rơmo tơno tơ Gilgal. Chơnang soi lu sư gô jing pôi tơmo tơ lăm trong đêl choh lăm mir.

English: Jacob fled to the country of Syria; Israel served for a spouse, And for a wife he tended sheep.
Bahnar: Jakôp kơdâu tơ char Aram, tơ noh Isơrael jang gleh wă kơ đei akăn, yua kơ wă kơ đei akăn, na sư wei triu.

English: By a prophet the LORD brought Israel out of Egypt, And by a prophet he was preserved.
Bahnar: Kră Yang yua minh 'nu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol chông anhăk Isơrael lĕch boih đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ, păng yua minh 'nu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol wei-lăng sư.

English: Ephraim provoked Him to anger most bitterly; Therefore his Lord will leave the guilt of his bloodshed upon him, And return his reproach upon him.
Bahnar: Êphraim tơ tơblĕk Inh blĕk Inh. Yua kơ thoi noh Kră Yang lu sư gô pơm tơwih kơ lu sư pŭ iŏk pham lĕch yua kơ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ dêh lu sư pơm păng gô pơdrâu ăn tơdrong mơlâu kơ lu sư.

English: When Ephraim spoke, trembling, He exalted himself in Israel; But when he offended through Baal worship, he died.
Bahnar: Rim wơ̆t bơngai Êphraim pơma, lu đe hli tơtơ̆; đe pôk hơtŏk lu sư lăm char Isơrael. Mă-lei lu sư yoch boih yua kơ đơ̆ng kơkuh kơ yang Baal na pơm kơ lu sư lôch.

English: Now they sin more and more, And have made for themselves molded images, Idols of their silver, according to their skill; All of it is the work of craftsmen. They say of them, “Let the men who sacrifice kiss the calves!”
Bahnar: Dang ei, lu sư pơm yoch rai dêh; lu sư yua hu, tuh hling pơm lơ rup yang kơ lu sư kơdih, pơm lu rup yang kiơ̆ kơ đon hơgei lu sư; đĭ-đăng ti lu sư thơ̆ hơgei! Đe đei roi trŏ kơ 'bơm lu sư khan: Pơm yang kơ rup kon rơmo păng chŭm rup kon rơmo noh!

English: Therefore they shall be like the morning cloud And like the early dew that passes away, Like chaff blown off from a threshing floor And like smoke from a chimney.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu sư nhen thoi tŭk pơgê hrôih kư̆m thoi iĕ kơ đak ngom pơgê 'bônh kơ hrĕng, kư̆m thoi hơkam ba kial bơbơ̆t đơ̆ng anih juă 'ba, thoi 'nhui lĕch đơ̆ng 'măng-'mŏk.

English: “Yet I am the LORD your God Ever since the land of Egypt, And you shall know no God but Me; For there is no savior besides Me.
Bahnar: Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm dŏng iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ. Lăp minh Inh đĕch, iĕm 'nĕ kơ đei yang nai; 'nguaih kơ Inh ưh kơ đei yang kiơ nai mă gơh dŏng pơklaih iĕm!

English: I knew you in the wilderness, In the land of great drought.
Bahnar: Inh boih wei rong iĕm lăm char glă păng anih hrĕng kro sơ̆.

English: When they had pasture, they were filled; They were filled and their heart was exalted; Therefore they forgot Me.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư sŏng sa phĭ boih, jơhngơ̆m lu sư jing pơang; yua kơ đơ̆ng noh na lu sư hiơt boih kơ inh.

English: “So I will be to them like a lion; Like a leopard by the road I will lurk
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Inh gô pơm kơ lu sư thoi dăm-brang, Inh gô thoi djrang răp lu sư rok trong.

English: I will meet them like a bear deprived of her cubs; I will tear open their rib cage, And there I will devour them like a lion. The wild beast shall tear them.
Bahnar: Inh gô châu lu sư thoi chơgơu yŏng bruh kơ đe rôp tơgar iŏk kon sư. Inh gô châu hek hơđah kơtơh lu sư, đơ̆ng noh inh gô kăp sa lu sư thoi dăm-brang yŏng. Lu sem bri gô hek sa lu sư.

English: “O Israel, you are destroyed, But your help is from Me.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai Isơrael, Inh gô pơrăm iĕm, yua kơ lu iĕm sơngah păng blah Inh, Tơ'ngla mă dŏng tơgŭm iĕm.

English: I will be your King; Where is any other, That he may save you in all your cities? And your judges to whom you said, ‘Give me a king and princes’?
Bahnar: Dang ei tơ yơ pơtao iĕm juăt ngăl dŏng pơklaih iĕm? Tơ yơ đĭ-đăng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r iĕm lăm rim pơlei? Tơ yơ lu yŏng mă lu bơngai iĕm ngăl khan: Ăn kơ lu nhôn đei minh 'nu pơtao păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r!

English: I gave you a king in My anger, And took him away in My wrath.
Bahnar: Inh ăn pơhil boih kơ lu iĕm minh 'nu pơtao, păng yua kơ Inh hil na inh pơdrâu lê̆.

English: “The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up; His sin is stored up.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kơnê̆ lu bơngai Êphraim Inh oei 'blŏk, tơdrong yoch lu sư Inh kư̆m chih 'măn lê̆.

English: The sorrows of a woman in childbirth shall come upon him. He is an unwise son, For he should not stay long where children are born.
Bahnar: Tơdrong jĭ thoi drŏ-kăn tơpŭ truh boih kơ lu sư, mă-lei lu sư thoi kon nge ngŏk kơ hlôh kơwao, Lăp truh jơ 'năr boih, mă-lei sư ưh kơ jah lĕch đơ̆ng tơpu kon.

English: “I will ransom them from the power of the grave; I will redeem them from death. O Death, I will be your plagues! O Grave, I will be your destruction! Pity is hidden from My eyes.”
Bahnar: Inh gô dŏng pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng tơdrong pran kơtang dêh atâu, păng gô pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng tơdrong lôch. Ơ tơdrong lôch tơ yơ tơdrong lôch hơbuh gơh pơrăm? Ơ dêh atâu tơ yơ tơdrong ih gơh pơrăm. Inh pă gơh mơnat boih.

English: Though he is fruitful among his brethren, An east wind shall come; The wind of the LORD shall come up from the wilderness. Then his spring shall become dry, And his fountain shall be dried up. He shall plunder the treasury of every desirable prize.
Bahnar: Mă khan Êphraim đei pơjing rai lơ hloh kơ lu 'nhŏng oh sư, mă-lei kial đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch gô truh, wă khan kial Kră Yang đơ̆ng char glă, gô truh pơhrĕng pơhrơ̆ lê̆ tu đak, păng pơhrơ̆ lê̆ kro lu sơlŭng đak sư, Lu bơngai ayăt gô blah tơgar iŏk lu tơmam gĭt đơ̆ng lăm hnam mong tơmam sư.

English: Samaria is held guilty, For she has rebelled against her God. They shall fall by the sword, Their infants shall be dashed in pieces, And their women with child ripped open.
Bahnar: Bơngai Samari gô pŭ tơdrong yoch, yua kơ lu sư iung blah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư. Lu sư gô pơ̆k lôch yua kơ đao gưm, lu kon hơ'lơ̆p sư đe gô teh pơlôch păng lu drŏ-kăn mă oei anăp đe gô roch klak.

English: O Israel, return to the LORD your God, For you have stumbled because of your iniquity
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai Isơrael, wih brŏk bĕ tơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm; yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ lu iĕm, na lu iĕm pơ̆k huŏng boih.

English: Take words with you, And return to the LORD. Say to Him, “Take away all iniquity; Receive us graciously, For we will offer the sacrifices of our lips.
Bahnar: Krao apinh bĕ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, păng jah wih brŏk bĕ tơ Sư. Khan bĕ kơ Sư thoi âu: Pơklaih bĕ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ lu nhôn, apinh Ih 'mêm mơnat sơng iŏk lu nhôn, wă kơ lu nhôn gơh pơyơ̆r nơ̆r bơnê đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r lu nhôn.

English: Assyria shall not save us, We will not ride on horses, Nor will we say anymore to the work of our hands, ‘You are our gods.’ For in You the fatherless finds mercy.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Asiri ưh kơ gơh pơklaih lu nhôn ôh; lu nhôn ưh pă hao aseh tơblah dơ̆ng, ưh pă khan dơ̆ng yang lu nhôn! Mă man hăm ti lu nhôn noh, yua kơ Ih đĕch mơnat kơ lu kon mơti.

English: “I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely, For My anger has turned away from him.
Bahnar: Inh gô ming pơklaih tơdrong lu sư blơ̆ blĕch kơ Inh, Inh 'mêm tơpă kơ lu sư boih, Inh pă hil kơ lu sư boih.

English: I will be like the dew to Israel; He shall grow like the lily, And lengthen his roots like Lebanon.
Bahnar: Inh gô jing thoi đak ngom kơ bơngai Isơrael, lu sư gô pơkao thoi pơkao hla tŏng-mŏng păng kư̆m chăt rơh thoi tơm 'long hơngo char Liban.

English: His branches shall spread; His beauty shall be like an olive tree, And his fragrance like Lebanon.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tơmơ̆ng lu sư bluh rai kơjung; arih 'lơ̆ng sư thoi tơm 'long ôliwơ, 'bâu phu lu sư thoi 'bâu phu 'long hơngo Liban.

English: Those who dwell under his shadow shall return; They shall be revived like grain, And grow like a vine. Their scent shall be like the wine of Lebanon.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô wih ngôi ala yơ̆p Inh. Lu sư gô iung bluh dơ̆ng thoi tơnơm 'ba. Lu sư gô pơkao thoi pơkao 'long hơmu, păng đe ư-ang sư thoi đe ư-ang đak sik plei hơmu char Liban.

English: “Ephraim shall say, ‘What have I to do anymore with idols?’ I have heard and observed him. I am like a green cypress tree; Your fruit is found in Me.”
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai Êphraim, Inh wă pơm kiơ dơ̆ng hăm lu rup yang? Inh boih gô drơ̆ng tơdrong lu iĕm krao khan păng wei-lăng lu iĕm. Inh thoi minh tơnơm 'long hơngo hla iĕ hơdrih ling-lang đơ̆ng Inh boih mă lu iĕm đei plei.

English: Who is wise? Let him understand these things. Who is prudent? Let him know them. For the ways of the LORD are right; The righteous walk in them, But transgressors stumble in them.
Bahnar: Bu jing bơngai hơgei, sư athei băt hlôh dôm tơdrong âu? Bu mă băt lăng hơlen, sư athei lăng bĕ lu tơdrong noh. Trong Kră Yang 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, lu bơngai tơpăt gô yak trong noh; mă-lei lu bơngai pơm yoch glăi gô yak kơtơih pơ̆k tơ noh.
